text: ah right haven't tried the websocket one - so basically any time a contract changes it'll send a message. I'm just trying to mirror the results into a postgres to be able to query from that for the app instead of on the fly ledger calls which are relatively slow as it grows

text: Hi <@U012DRCTM61>.  Have you looked at the <https://docs.digitalasset.com/build/3.3/component-howtos/pqs/index.html|Participant Query Store> which is our SQL API to the ledger?

.  Have you looked at the
Participant Query Store
which is our SQL API to the ledger?

text: came across it but never tried - any good simple examples i can reference? Docs made it feel complicated

elements.text: came across it but never tried - any good simple examples i can reference? Docs made it feel complicated

text: <https://discuss.daml.com/t/a-docker-compose-demo-of-the-participant-query-store-pqs/7074?u=wallacekelly|This> uses Canton 2.x, but the concepts are the same.

attachments.fallback: Daml Developers Community: A Docker Compose demo of the Participant Query Store (PQS)
attachments.text: Background The Participant Query Store (PQS) stores a copy of ledger data in a relational database for the purpose of performing fast and efficient queries of that data. This demo starts a minimal PQS in Docker, enabling you to explore the schema and data that is copied into the PQS database. The PQS is an Enterprise feature. You will need credentials to the Digital Asset Artifactory to run this demo. Clone the code To follow along, clone the demo as follows: git clone <https://github.com/wall>...
attachments.title: A Docker Compose demo of the Participant Query Store (PQS)

elements.text: This
uses Canton 2.x, but the concepts are the same.
